interpretation_summary: The replication executed successfully within a Dockerized Python environment, implementing the preregistered OLS model with HC1-robust SEs on the post-original window (2020-04-04 to 2020-08-11). Variables (EIU democracy scaled 0–10, temperature, openness) and listwise deletion matched the plan (n=150). The coefficient on democracy was positive but statistically insignificant (coef=46.35, SE=191.33, p=0.809), with low explanatory power (R-squared=0.010). This outcome does not provide evidence supporting a robust positive association in the replication window.

fidelity_assessment.method_alignment: High alignment: OLS with HC1-robust SEs on cases per million using EIU democracy (scaled 0–10), temperature, and openness over 2020-04-04 to 2020-08-11. Data loaded from provided RDS; listwise deletion applied; artifacts exported as specified.

deviations.issue_description: Runtime adjustments for exporting statsmodels results and plotting (handling numpy arrays).
deviations.impact: Low: Purely technical; no impact on estimates or inference.

results_comparison.hypothesis_tested: Across countries, higher democracy (EIU 0–10) is associated with a higher number of confirmed COVID-19 infections per million in the post-original window (2020-04-04 to 2020-08-11).
results_comparison.original_results: Original claim (as summarized in preregistration materials) posited a positive association between democracy and COVID-19 cases. Numerical benchmarks from the original are not reported here; consult the original paper for exact coefficients and p-values.
results_comparison.replication_results: Democracy coefficient = 46.35 (HC1 SE = 191.33), 95% CI [-331.78, 424.47], p = 0.809; R-squared = 0.010; n = 150. Controls (temperature, openness) not significant.
results_comparison.overall_answer: No. The replication does not find a statistically significant positive effect of democracy on COVID-19 cases in the specified replication window.

replication_report: Replication executed as planned: OLS with HC1 SEs on the specified window yielded a positive but non-significant democracy coefficient (p=0.809), offering no supportive evidence for the focal positive association in this period.

failure_handling.suggestions: Provide explicit original numerical benchmarks in the preregistration or include extraction from the original paper to enable a direct numeric comparison (e.g., effect size ratios or overlap of CIs).
None material detected. For robustness, predefine alternative SEs (e.g., HC3) and outlier treatments in preregistration to assess sensitivity.

notes: Low R-squared and wide CIs suggest limited precision; results may be sensitive to sample composition and time window. Consider robustness checks (e.g., alternative time windows, additional controls, or influence diagnostics) and report power calculations for the observed effect size.
